author: lattechad
content:
Question:

Why has development of an EIP (969/3369/3372) to remove asics from the network been left to the community instead of ether devs working on this issue, when the ether white paper clearly states that the network should not allow asic mining?

author: gwintery
content: Ethereum development is decentralized. Devs are free to work on issues they believe in or are interested in. Seems like most current core devs believes the merge is a more beneficial step to take rather than focusing on those aforemention EIPs. On the other hand, if anyone does wish to push that EIP forward to the core devs and is willing to take the time and effort to see it until realization, then you may see some success in getting those implemented.

author: lattechad
content: I don't think there's an issue with time/effort amongst supporters of such change, but the lack of technical knowledge is severely hampering work. Is there no one here that recognises the danger posed by the centralisation of mining amongst asic operators *in the meantime before 2.0* which is slated for ~15 months away I believe

author: lattechad
content: From an outside perspective it really looks like ethereum is asleep at the wheel when it comes to this issue. I was one of a few campaigning for this to be looked at back when the 1559-mining channel was open. There was basically radio silence when it was brought up time and again. Then eventually we were told 'you do it'. We don't know how

author: pipermerriam
content: There's almost no chance of getting core dev buy in on 969/3369/3372 (I'm assuming those are progpow and the like).  The merge and transition to proof of stake eliminate asics and are being actively worked on.
